implementation.name: Addition (choice == 1)
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the addition operation when the user selects option 1. It reads two numbers from input and prints their sum.
implementation.pseudo_code:
LOOP forever:
    DISPLAY menu options
    GET user choice as integer
    GET first number as integer
    GET second number as integer
    IF choice is 1:
        PRINT sum of first and second number
    ELSE IF choice is 2:
        PRINT difference
    ELSE IF choice is 3:
        PRINT product
    ELSE IF choice is 4:
        PRINT quotient
    ELSE IF choice is 5:
        PRINT exit message
        BREAK loop
    PRINT newline

missing_implementations: Check for the error with negative number

implementation.name: Calculator Main Loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the subtraction operation as part of a menu-driven calculator. The subtraction is performed when the user selects option 2.
implementation.pseudo_code:
LOOP forever:
    Display menu options
    Get user choice as integer
    Get first number as integer
    Get second number as integer
    IF choice == 1:
        Output sum
    ELSE IF choice == 2:
        Output difference (num1 - num2)
    ELSE IF choice == 3:
        Output product
    ELSE IF choice == 4:
        Output division
    ELSE IF choice == 5:
        Exit loop
    Print newline

missing_implementations: All error messages should be generic and user-friendly.
Internal error details must not be exposed to users.
Detailed errors should be logged securely for debugging.
All user inputs must be strictly validated and sanitized to ensure they are numbers within acceptable ranges and free from malicious content.

implementation.name: main calculator loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the calculator logic, including multiplication, by reading user input, performing the operation, and displaying the result.
implementation.pseudo_code:
PRINT welcome message
LOOP forever:
    PRINT menu options
    GET user choice as integer
    GET first number as integer
    GET second number as integer
    IF choice is 1:
        PRINT sum
    ELSE IF choice is 2:
        PRINT difference
    ELSE IF choice is 3:
        PRINT product (multiplication)
    ELSE IF choice is 4:
        PRINT division
    ELSE IF choice is 5:
        PRINT exit message
        BREAK loop
    PRINT newline

Internal error details must not be exposed to users.
Detailed errors should be logged securely for debugging.
All user inputs must be strictly validated and sanitized to ensure they are numbers within acceptable ranges and free from malicious content.

implementation.name: Division branch in main loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: This is the main code block that performs division when the user selects option 4. It directly executes the division operation and outputs the result.
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF user selects option 4 (Division):
    Prompt user for first number (num1)
    Prompt user for second number (num2)
    Output the result of num1 divided by num2

implementation.name: Division operation (main loop branch)
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the division operation as part of the calculator's main loop. When the user selects option 4, it performs division of two user-provided inputs.
implementation.pseudo_code:
LOOP forever:
    Display menu options
    Get user choice as integer
    Get first number as integer input
    Get second number as integer input
    IF choice == 4:
        Output result of num1 / num2
